name: A-10C Thunderbolt II
description: Twin-engine, straight-wing jet aircraft designed for close air support, with a distinctive 30mm GAU-8 Avenger rotary cannon, known for its durability and ability to operate in low-altitude environments.

name: A-29C Super Tucano
description: Light attack aircraft with counter-insurgency capabilities, featuring advanced avionics and weapons systems, used primarily for pilot training and light attack missions.

name: AC-130J Ghostrider
description: Heavily armed ground-attack variant of the C-130 transport aircraft, equipped with precision strike capabilities and sophisticated sensor systems for close air support missions.

name: B-1B Lancer
description: Supersonic variable-sweep wing heavy bomber with long-range capabilities, featuring an advanced electronic jamming system and the ability to deploy both conventional and nuclear weapons.

name: B-2A Spirit
description: Strategic stealth bomber with flying wing design, capable of delivering both conventional and nuclear weapons, known for its low observable stealth technology.

name: B-21 Raider
description: Next-generation stealth bomber designed to replace the B-2 Spirit and B-1 Lancer, featuring advanced stealth technology and the capability for both manned and unmanned operation.

name: B-52H Stratofortress
description: Long-range, subsonic strategic bomber that has been in service since the 1950s, capable of carrying a wide range of weapons including nuclear bombs, cruise missiles, and precision-guided munitions.

name: C-5M Super Galaxy
description: Strategic transport aircraft and one of the largest military aircraft in the world, used for carrying oversized cargo over intercontinental ranges.

name: C-12C/D/F/J Huron
description: Military version of the Beechcraft King Air, used for utility transport, passenger and light cargo transport, and reconnaissance missions.

name: C-130H Hercules
description: Four-engine turboprop military transport aircraft designed for troop, medical evacuation, and cargo transport, capable of operating from unprepared runways.

name: C-130J Super Hercules/J-30 Super Hercules
description: Upgraded version of the C-130 with improved performance, featuring new engines, digital avionics, and increased cargo capacity.

name: C-146A Wolfhound
description: Medium-sized, twin-engine transport aircraft used for special operations missions, capable of short takeoff and landing operations.

name: C-147A
description: Light utility aircraft used by the U.S. Army Parachute Team for parachute demonstration missions.

name: C-17A Globemaster III
description: Strategic airlifter used for rapid strategic airlift of troops and cargo to main operating bases or forward operating locations worldwide.

name: C-21A Learjet 35
description: Twin-engine jet aircraft used for passenger and cargo airlift, aeromedical evacuation, and other priority missions.

name: C-32A/B Air Force Two
description: Military passenger transport aircraft, a modified Boeing 757 primarily used to transport the Vice President and other high-ranking government officials.

name: C-37A/B Gulfstream V
description: VIP transport aircraft based on the Gulfstream V business jet, used to transport high-ranking military and government officials.

name: C-40B/C
description: Military version of the Boeing 737-700C used for transporting high-ranking military and government officials, with advanced communications capabilities.

name: CN-235
description: Medium-range twin-engine transport aircraft used for special operations missions, with maritime patrol and surveillance capabilities.

name: CV-22B Osprey
description: Tiltrotor aircraft combining the vertical takeoff, hover, and vertical landing capabilities of a helicopter with the speed and range of a turboprop aircraft, used primarily for special operations.

name: E-3B/G Sentry
description: Airborne Warning and Control System aircraft providing surveillance, command, control, and communications functions for tactical and air defense forces.

name: E-4B
description: National Airborne Operations Center, a militarized version of the Boeing 747-200, serves as a mobile command post in the event of national emergency or destruction of ground command centers.

name: E-9A Widget
description: Airborne surveillance and range instrumentation platform used to monitor missile test ranges and provide telemetry data.

name: E-11A
description: Battlefield Airborne Communications Node, providing communications relay and information gateway services across the battlespace.

name: EA-37B Compass Call
description: Electronic attack aircraft designed to disrupt enemy command and control communications and limit adversary coordination.

name: EC-130H Compass Call
description: Electronic warfare and aerial battlefield communications jamming aircraft based on the C-130 Hercules.

name: EC-130J & Super-J
description: Advanced electronic warfare variants of the C-130J platform with enhanced electronic attack capabilities.

name: F-117 Nighthawk
description: First operational stealth aircraft, now used in limited capacity for aggressor training and developmental testing despite official retirement.

name: F-15C/D Eagle
description: Twin-engine, all-weather tactical fighter designed for air superiority, known for its exceptional maneuverability and acceleration.

name: F-15E Strike Eagle
description: Dual-role fighter capable of engaging both ground and air targets, featuring advanced avionics and the capability to deploy a wide range of weapons.

name: F-15EX Eagle II
description: Modern variant of the F-15 with advanced avionics, increased weapons capacity, and improved performance, designed to replace aging F-15C/D fleet.

name: F-16C/D Fighting Falcon
description: Compact, multi-role fighter aircraft known for its agility and versatility in both air-to-air and air-to-ground missions.

name: F-22A Raptor
description: Fifth-generation stealth tactical fighter with supercruise capability, thrust vectoring, and advanced avionics for air superiority missions.

name: F-35A Lightning II
description: Fifth-generation stealth multirole fighter with advanced sensors and networking capabilities for air superiority and strike missions.

name: HC-130J Combat King II
description: Extended-range search and rescue variant of the C-130J, equipped for personnel recovery missions in hostile environments.

name: HH-60G/U Pave Hawk

name: HH-60W Jolly Green II

name: KC-135R/T Stratotanker

name: KC-46A Pegasus

name: LC-130H Hercules

name: MC-12W Liberty

name: MC-130J Commando II

name: MH-139A Grey Wolf

name: MQ-1B Predator

name: MQ-9A Reaper

name: BQM-167 Skeeter

name: P-9A Pale Ale

name: QF-16A/C

name: RC-135S/U/V/W Cobra Ball/Combat Sent/Rivet Joint

name: RQ-4B Global Hawk

name: Unmanned Long-endurance Tactical Reconnaissance Aircraft

name: T-1A Jayhawk

name: MQ-8C Fire Scout
description: Small tactical unmanned aircraft system providing intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance capabilities to naval expeditionary forces.

name: X-37B
description: Larger, more capable version of the MQ-8B based on the Bell 407 helicopter airframe for extended range and payload capacity.

name: M109A6 Paladin
description: Self-propelled howitzer featuring a 155mm cannon with digital fire control system, onboard navigation, and the ability to receive fire missions, compute firing data, and position itself - all without external assistance, providing shoot and scoot capability.

name: M109A7
description: Next-generation self-propelled howitzer replacing the M109A6 Paladin, featuring improved chassis, automotive systems, and power generation to support future networked capabilities and enhanced survivability.

name: M992A3
description: Tracked armored ammunition carrier companion to the M109 self-propelled howitzer, designed to transport projectiles, propellant charges, and fuzes to resupply howitzers during combat operations.

name: Towed Artillery
description: Collection of various towed artillery platforms that require a separate vehicle for movement, characterized by their mobility, deployability, and firepower in artillery support roles.

name: M119
description: Lightweight 105mm towed howitzer designed for airborne, air assault, and mountain operations, featuring high mobility with helicopter transportability and ability to be broken down for transport by light vehicles.

name: M777
description: Ultralight 155mm towed howitzer constructed with titanium and aluminum alloys, featuring digital fire control systems for improved accuracy and rapid deployment capability via helicopter lift.

name: Rocket Artillery
description: Collection of vehicle-mounted multiple rocket launcher systems providing indirect fire support with high-volume firepower and various munition options for area suppression.

name: M270
description: Tracked, armored multiple launch rocket system capable of launching 12 guided MLRS rockets or two Army Tactical Missile System  missiles with high mobility and protected crew compartment.

name: M142 HIMARS
description: High Mobility Artillery Rocket System mounted on a wheeled chassis, providing a lighter, more deployable version of the M270s firepower with the ability to launch six MLRS rockets or one ATACMS missile.

name: Mortars
description: Infantry support weapons providing high-angle indirect fire capability for close-range combat support, available in various calibers and deployment configurations.

name: Cardom
description: Advanced recoil mortar system mounted on Stryker vehicles, featuring automated laying and loading systems, digital fire control, and rapid deployment capability for infantry fire support.

name: M1287 mortar carrier vehicle
description: Tracked 120mm mortar platform based on the AMPV chassis, providing protected, mobile indirect fire support with improved crew protection and digital fire control systems.

name: XM905 advanced mortar protection system
description: Automated 120mm mortar turret system designed for base defense operations, featuring remote operation capability and integrated fire control systems.

name: M224
description: Lightweight 60mm infantry mortar system designed for dismounted operations, providing immediate indirect fire support to infantry units with high portability and rapid deployment.

name: M252
description: Medium 81mm infantry mortar providing greater range and explosive power than 60mm systems while maintaining reasonable portability for infantry operations.

name: M120
description: Heavy 120mm mortar system deployable in both ground-mounted and vehicle-mounted configurations, delivering significant explosive power for close infantry support.

name: Air defense systems
description: Varied collection of weapon systems designed to detect, track, and engage aerial threats including aircraft, helicopters, cruise missiles, and drones.

name: Centurion
description: Land-based adaptation of the naval Phalanx Close-In Weapon System, using a rapid-fire 20mm cannon for Counter-Rocket, Artillery, and Mortar  defense of fixed installations.

name: AN/TWQ-1
description: Self-propelled, lightweight air defense system mounted on a Humvee, armed with Stinger missiles to provide mobile short-range air defense for maneuver forces.

name: M-SHORAD
description: Stryker-based Short Range Air Defense system featuring missiles, a 30mm cannon, and machine guns to counter air threats including unmanned aerial systems, rotary-wing, and fixed-wing aircraft.

name: MIM-104
specialty: Mobile, long-range surface-to-air missile with anti-ballistic missile capability
description: Patriot surface-to-air missile system providing medium to high-altitude air and missile defense with multi-target engagement capability and advanced radar systems.

name: THAAD
description: Terminal High Altitude Area Defense system designed to shoot down short, medium, and intermediate-range ballistic missiles during their terminal phase using hit-to-kill technology.

name: M1 Abrams
description: Main battle tank featuring composite armor, 120mm main gun, advanced fire control systems, and gas turbine engine, providing the backbone of U.S. armored warfare capability.

name: M10 Booker
description: Light tank designed for infantry support operations, featuring a 105mm main gun on a mobile, protected platform to enhance infantry brigade combat capabilities.

name: Infantry Fighting Vehicles
description: Category of armored combat vehicles designed to transport infantry into battle while providing direct fire support with organic weapon systems.

name: M1120 Stryker
specialty: Armored personnel carrier –infantry fighting vehicle hybrid
description: Family of eight-wheeled armored vehicles serving in various configurations from infantry carrier to reconnaissance, medical evacuation, and fire support, prioritizing mobility and deployability.

name: M2 Bradley
description: Tracked infantry fighting vehicle armed with a 25mm chain gun, TOW missile launcher, and 7.62mm machine gun, providing both troop transport and direct fire support capabilities.

name: M3 Bradley
description: Cavalry fighting vehicle variant of the M2 Bradley optimized for reconnaissance and security operations, with enhanced observation equipment and reduced troop carrying capacity.

name: Armoured Personnel Carriers
description: Armored vehicles designed primarily for transporting infantry to the battlefield with protection from small arms fire and artillery fragments.

name: Armored Ground Mobility System
description: Specialized light armored vehicle used by special operations forces for covert insertion and mobility in high-risk environments.

name: Armored Multi-Purpose Vehicle
description: Family of tracked armored vehicles based on the Bradley Fighting Vehicle chassis, replacing the aging M113 in various battlefield roles including command post, medical evacuation, and general purpose transport.

name: M113
description: Legacy tracked armored personnel carrier introduced in the 1960s, serving in numerous variants from basic troop transport to command post, mortar carrier, and ambulance roles.

name: M1117
description: Wheeled armored security vehicle featuring a turret-mounted 40mm grenade launcher and .50 caliber machine gun, providing protected mobility for military police and security operations.

name: Mine Resistant Ambush Protected Vehicles
description: Category of vehicles designed with V-shaped hulls and elevated chassis to mitigate effects of IED blasts, prioritizing crew survivability in asymmetric warfare.

name: International MaxxPro
description: MRAP vehicle featuring V-shaped hull design, armor protection, and elevated chassis, used primarily for troop transport in environments with mine and IED threats.

name: M-ATV
description: Mine Resistant Ambush Protected All-Terrain Vehicle combining MRAP protection levels with off-road mobility for operations in challenging terrain like Afghanistan.

name: Buffalo
description: Heavy MRAP vehicle specialized for route clearance operations, featuring an articulated arm and claw for examining and removing suspected explosive devices.

name: Cougar
description: Family of MRAP vehicles available in 4x4 and 6x6 configurations, providing protected transport for troops, command and control, and EOD operations in high-threat environments.

name: RG-31
description: South African-designed MRAP vehicle adopted by U.S. forces, featuring V-shaped hull and modular armor for protection against mines and IEDs while transporting troops.

name: RG-33
description: Enhanced MRAP vehicle with larger interior volume than the RG-31, providing protected mobility for various missions including troop transport, ambulance, and EOD support.

name: Light vehicles
description: Category of non-armored or lightly armored tactical vehicles designed for reconnaissance, utility transport, and general mobility support.

name: High Mobility Multipurpose Wheeled Vehicle
description: Versatile 4x4 tactical vehicle serving in numerous roles from basic troop transport to weapons carrier, command vehicle, and ambulance.

name: Joint Light Tactical Vehicle
description: Next-generation light tactical vehicle replacing the Humvee, featuring enhanced protection, off-road mobility, and modular design for multiple mission configurations.

name: M1288 GMV 1.1
description: Special Operations Command variant of the JLTV designed for enhanced mobility, payload capacity, and transportability for special operations missions.

name: M1297 Army Ground Mobility Vehicle
description: Army variant of the GMV providing protected mobility for special operations and specialized infantry units with enhanced off-road capability.

name: M1301 Infantry Squad Vehicle
description: Lightweight, air-droppable off-road vehicle based on the Chevrolet Colorado ZR2 chassis, designed to transport a nine-soldier infantry squad with their equipment.

name: Ranger Special Operations Vehicle
description: Lightweight, highly mobile 4x4 vehicle used by special forces for reconnaissance, rapid assault, and extraction operations in challenging environments.

name: Logistics Vehicles
description: Category of trucks and transport vehicles designed to move equipment, supplies, ammunition, and fuel to support military operations.

name: Family of Medium Tactical Vehicles
description: Standardized series of 2.5 and 5-ton capacity tactical trucks in various configurations for cargo, troop transport, and specialized equipment carrying roles.

name: Heavy Expanded Mobility Tactical Truck
description: 8x8 heavy tactical truck with 10-ton payload capacity used for ammunition transport, refueling, recovery, and heavy equipment transport.

name: M1070 Heavy Equipment Transporter
description: Combination of powerful tractor unit and specialized trailer designed to transport main battle tanks and other heavy military equipment over long distances.

name: M939 series 5-ton 6×6 truck
description: Legacy 5-ton capacity military cargo truck used for transporting troops, equipment, and supplies in various tactical situations.

name: Palletized Load System
description: Advanced logistics vehicle capable of self-loading and unloading standardized cargo containers without external equipment, enhancing distribution efficiency.

name: Small Unit Support Vehicle
description: Tracked, amphibious vehicle designed for logistics support in extreme cold weather and challenging terrain where wheeled vehicles cannot operate.

name: Cold Weather All-Terrain Vehicles
description: Specialized tracked vehicles designed specifically for operations in Arctic conditions, providing mobility and transport in snow, ice, and extreme cold.

name: Engineering Vehicles
description: Category of specialized vehicles designed for combat engineering tasks including obstacle breaching, route clearance, and battlefield preparation.

name: M88 Hercules
description: Armored recovery vehicle designed to recover damaged or disabled tanks and other heavy vehicles under combat conditions, featuring a powerful winch, crane, and towing capability.

name: M9 Armored Combat Earthmover
description: Tracked bulldozer with armor protection, designed to construct fighting positions, clear obstacles, and prepare defensive positions under combat conditions.

name: D9
description: Heavily armored version of the commercial Caterpillar D9 bulldozer, adapted for military use in clearing obstacles, preparing routes, and constructing defensive positions in combat zones.

name: M60 Armoured Vehicle Launched Bridge
description: Tank chassis-based vehicle carrying a folding bridge that can be deployed to allow other vehicles to cross gaps up to 18 meters wide.

name: M104 Wolverine
description: Heavy mechanized bridge system based on the M1 Abrams chassis, providing rapid gap-crossing capability for heavy forces with minimal exposure to enemy fire.

name: M1074 Joint Assault Bridge System
description: Abrams-based bridge layer featuring improved bridge deployment systems and enhanced protection for the crew during bridging operations.

name: M1150 Assault Breacher Vehicle
description: Combat engineering vehicle based on the M1 Abrams chassis, designed to clear minefields and complex obstacles using plows, explosive line charges, and other tools.

name: Aardvark JSFU
description: Joint Service Flail Unit designed to safely detonate land mines by beating the ground with chains attached to a rotating drum, creating cleared paths through minefields.

name: Husky VMMD
description: Vehicle Mounted Mine Detector using ground-penetrating radar and metal detectors to locate buried mines while providing operator protection against detonation effects.

name: Hydrema MCV 910
description: Mine-clearing vehicle featuring a rotating flail system to detonate mines ahead of advancing forces, creating safe lanes through minefields.

name: M58 Mine Clearing Line Charge
description: Trailer-mounted rocket system that deploys an explosive line charge to clear lanes through minefields by detonating or destroying mines in its path.
